doc.field: Brooklyn Democratic Club Silas Wright centennial dinner records
Brooklyn Democratic Club Silas Wright centennial dinner records

The Brooklyn Democratic Club Silas Wright centennial dinner records include an announcement, programs, clippings, letters, and a ribbon regarding the club's dinner celebrating the 100th anniversary of the birth of Silas Wright in 1895.

The Brooklyn Democratic Club Silas Wright centennial dinner records include an announcement, programs, clippings, letters, and a ribbon regarding the club's dinner celebrating the 100th anniversary of the birth of Silas Wright in 1895.

The Brooklyn Democratic Club was located at 201 Montague Street. Officers of the Club were Harrington Putnam, President; Alexander Orr and others, Vice-Presidents; Sidney V. Lowell, Chairman of the Governing Committee; Frances Gottsberger, Treasurer; and Charles A. Kelly, Corresponding Secretary.

Silas Wright was born on May 24, 1795. He graduated from Middlebury College in Vermont in 1816. In 1824, he was elected as a New York State Senator. In 1826, he was elected to the U.S. House. From 1829-1833, he served as New York State Comptroller. From 1833-1844, he served as a United States Senator. In 1845, he took office as Governor of New York, but lost his reelection bid in 1846. He passed away on August 26, 1847.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1978.
